title: introduction
text: install development version REnergy GitHub, use: Using Shiny App main feature REnergy package Shiny app allows explore renewable energy data interactively. launch Shiny app, load package call launch_shiny_app() function: open Shiny app default web browser. app includes following features: Investment Trends: Select energy type view total investments time (2010-2023). Energy Production Type: Select year view breakdown renewable energy production type. Accessing Cleaned Data prefer working data directly, can access cleaned data included package. dataset contains information investment USD energy production GWh, filtered Australia 2010 2023. load cleaned data: Example Analysis Let’s say want analyze total investments different renewable energy types time. ’s simple example using dplyr package: example groups data energy_type calculates total investment type, helping understand types renewable energy received funding. Conclusion REnergy package provides interactive way explore renewable energy trends Australia, using Shiny app direct data access. vignette shown install package, launch Shiny app, use cleaned dataset custom analyses. details specific functions data, refer reference manual check function documentation within R.
code: #install.packages("remotes") # Uncomment if 'remotes' is not installed remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-akshatamhaski") library(REnergy) launch_shiny_app() data("cleaned_data", package = "REnergy") head(cleaned_data) #>   year   country energy_type investments_usd production_g_wh #> 1 2008 Australia  Geothermal       636188589       22205.069 #> 2 2020 Australia       Hydro      3891812730        3386.115 #> 3 2009 Australia       Solar       338009756       40218.011 #> 4 2011 Australia       Hydro      1638287454       73276.902 #> 5 2014 Australia       Hydro      1187775824       11187.967 #> 6 2020 Australia     Biomass       413571723       64826.378 library(dplyr)  # Summarize total investments by energy type investment_summary <- cleaned_data %>%   group_by(energy_type) %>%   summarize(total_investment = sum(investments_usd, na.rm = TRUE)) print(investment_summary)

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: REnergy package provides tools exploring renewable energy trends Australia, focus data 2010 2023. package includes Shiny app allows users visualize investment trends energy production breakdowns year energy type. package aims help analysts, researchers, policymakers gain insights renewable energy investment patterns production Australia.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version REnergy like :
code: #install.packages("remotes") # Uncomment if 'remotes' is not already installed remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-akshatamhaski")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Example ’s basic example use REnergy package. First, can load package launch Shiny app explore renewable energy data interactively: command open Shiny app default web browser. Within app, can explore: Investment Trends: Select energy type view total investments time (2010-2023). Energy Production Type: Select year view breakdown renewable energy production type. Alternatively, can access manipulate cleaned dataset directly prefer working raw data:
code: library(REnergy) launch_shiny_app() # Access the cleaned dataset for analysis data <- REnergy::get_cleaned_data()  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(data)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: REnergy package consists following key components: Shiny App: main feature package, providing interactive interface explore renewable energy trends Australia. Investment Trends Plot: line plot displays total investments energy type time. Energy Production Plot: bar plot shows production breakdown energy type selected year. get_cleaned_data(): Loads returns cleaned version renewable energy dataset. introduction vignette: comprehensive guide available vignette section, explaining use Shiny app work data.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: detailed documentation, see REnergy pkgdown site.

title: Get Cleaned Data — get_cleaned_data
text: data frame cleaned renewable energy data.

title: Launch the Shiny App — launch_shiny_app
text: function launches REnergy Shiny app data exploration.
